                                    Abu Dhabi Events                                               Music of the Arabian Peninsula                                                          Music of the Arabian Peninsula                                                              Conference      Music of the Arabian Peninsula                  By Invitation Only                                    Date                   March 1-3, 2015                                                                    Location           Abu Dhabi                                                                            Despite its centrality as the geographical diffusion point of the Arabs and the birthplace of Islam, the Arabian Peninsula—today comprising the countries Saudi Arabia, Yemen, Oman, the United Arab Emirates, Qatar, Bahrain, and Kuwait—is the origin of music that is much less known than that of more populous countries of Arabic speech. This workshop represents a rare opportunity to bring together senior and younger scholars in order to pose fundamental questions about what is already known, and what kinds of information would be needed to identify key issues in the musical life of today and of the recent past.   Image: Hatim Oweida/AramcoWorld                                                                     Convened by                              Virginia Danielson Director of the Library ,          NYUAD                                        Walter Feldman Professor of Music ,          NYUAD                                          Hosted by                              NYU Abu Dhabi Institute                                                                                              Kuwaiti Heritage: The Mayouf Bahri Band               Established in 1962, The Mayouf Bahri Band is renowned in Kuwait as a leading performer conserving the traditions of Kuwaiti Pearl Diving Music, as well as other folk music genres. This program features pearl diving songs, introduced and explained by an expert musicologist. NYUAD Arts Center                                                            The NYUAD Art Gallery                                                                                                                            Breadcrumbs                                  Home                                               Academics                                               Academic Divisions                                               Multidisciplinary                                               Arab Crossroads                                                          Arab Crossroads                                                     Program                              Faculty                              Courses                              Capstone                              Talks & Events                              Arabic Study Abroad Opportunities                                                                              Arab Crossroads Studies takes advantage of Abu Dhabi’s geographical location in the Arabian Peninsula, at the crossroads of the three continents of the Eastern hemisphere: Africa, Asia, and Europe. The historical, sociopolitical, and cultural interactions among these regions have opened engaging domains of study in both the humanities and social sciences. The flow of people, ideas, and commodities through the Gulf has made it a cosmopolitan and culturally hybrid setting for many centuries. The historical archives testify to this richness, which can also be gleaned from the artistic, architectural and musical developments, the variety of spoken languages, and the diversity of people who now live in the Gulf region.     Abu Dhabi is located in one of the most important regions in the world. The Arabian Peninsula is home to Islam’s holiest sites, and contains at least sixty percent of the world’s proven fossil fuel reserves. Having experienced foreign domination and experiencing political upheaval, Arab nations are evolving extremely rapidly. Abu Dhabi is a natural setting for studying the complex cultural, political, and economic dynamics of the Arab and Islamic worlds. The Arab Crossroads Studies program provides a portal for the global NYU community to study and engage with the cultural and intellectual diversity of this complex region, one we might think of as a space of multiple encounters and transactions.                                 Multidisciplinary Curriculum     History and Religion , which includes a broad and solid grounding in the pre-modern and modern social, cultural, religious and economic landscapes of the region. These courses focus on primary source documents to introduce students to the rich and varied history of the region as well as to the doctrinal and social aspects of the religious traditions that have shaped it.     Society and Politics , which includes a detailed and nuanced examination of the contemporary landscape of the region. These courses draw on anthropology, ethnography, political science, and sociology to elucidate the complex cultural, social, and political developments taking place today.     Arts and Literature , which includes a careful study of the literary, artistic, and philosophical landscapes of the region. These courses explore the literatures, arts, and physical environments of the region within their broader historical and social contexts.                                                                  Major in Arab Crossroads Studies                                                    The major in Arab Crossroads Studies combines multidisciplinary study with rigorous training in Arabic language.                                                              Concentration in Arab Crossroad Studies                                                    Complete a concentration in Arab Crossroads Studies with four courses.                                                              Regional Study Trips                                           Explore traditional irrigation in Oman.                                                                                                                             Village near Jabal Ali, Sultanate of Oman                                     Faculty Members                   Faculty Member Research Areas   Pascal Ménoret Modern Middle East; Saudi Arabia; Urbanism; Social Anthropology; Resistance and Protest Movements.  Philip Kennedy Medieval Arabic language and literature; classical poetry and poetics; adab; narrative and fiction; recognition/anagnorisis in literature; Qur'an and Tafsir.  Nathalie Peutz Anthropology; Ethnography; Borderland Studies; Yemen.  Justin Stearns Islamic History; Al-Andalus; Medieval and Early Modern Thought; History of Science; Religous Studies.                                                            Library of Arabic Literature (LAL)                                                    The Library of Arabic Literature project includes an international editorial board of leading Arabic scholars from around the world, each of whom will discuss their work at public workshops and lectures at NYU Abu Dhabi and other Abu Dhabi schools.                                                                       Pascal Menoret                       Assistant Professor of Middle Eastern Studies   He has published The Saudi Enigma: A History (2005) and is currently writing a book on the politics of youth in the Saudi capital, Riyadh.                                     Abu Dhabi Events                                               Boom Cities: Urban Development in the Arabian Peninsula                                                          Boom Cities: Urban Development in the Arabian Peninsula                                                              Conference      Boom Cities: Urban Development in the Arabian Peninsula                  Open to the Public                                    Date                   December 3-4, 2012                                                             Time           9:00am - 5:00pm                                                     Location           NYUAD Downtown Campus, Abu Dhabi                     View map                                          Related Links                              Agenda                                                                     Cities in the Arabian Peninsula are at the intersection of global energy markets, local and regional politics, international investment, religious networks, and labor migrations. This conference convenes international specialists of urban studies to map the latest evolutions in the field.   Papers prepared for and presented at this conference were published in the Fall 2013 volume of Arabian Humanities , an international journal of Archaeology and Social Sciences in the Arabian Peninsula published by The French Centre in Sana’a for Archaeology and Social Sciences (CEFAS).                                                                        Convened by                              Claire Beaugrand Postdoctoral Research Fellow ,          Institut Français du Proche-Orient, Beirut                                        Amélie Le Renard Research Fellow ,          Centre National de la Recherche Scientifique, France                                        Pascal Menoret Assistant Professor of Arab Crossroads Studies ,          NYUAD                                        Roman Stadnicki Head of Urban Studies Department ,          Centre d'Études et de Documentation Économiques, Juridiques et Sociales, Cairo                                                                                                Past Conferences       For Academic Year 2014-2015                                        April 11, 2015        Angel Rising - Investor Education Symposium                       April 10, 2015        The 2015 Annual NYUAD International Hackathon for Social Good in the Arab World                       March 15, 2015        Cosmopolitan Currents in the Indian Ocean                       March 8, 2015        Photography’s Shifting Terrain: Emerging Histories & New Practices                       March 1, 2015        Music of the Arabian Peninsula                       February 28, 2015        NYUAD Annual Research Conference 2015                       February 19, 2015        Imagine Science Film Festival Expanding Globally                       October 31, 2014        Public Health Think Tank 2014                                                                               Where the Sidewalk Ends: Informal Urbanism in Dubai               Seeking to go beyond the city as spectacle, this talk examines notions of informality as they pertain to the use of public spaces in Dubai, and introduces ongoing research that aims to map the city’s informal areas of encounter and uncover its hidden sites.                     Abu Dhabi Events                                               Music of the Arabian Peninsula                                                          Music of the Arabian Peninsula                                                              Conference      Music of the Arabian Peninsula                  By Invitation Only                                    Date                   March 1-3, 2015                                                                    Location           Abu Dhabi                                                                            Despite its centrality as the geographical diffusion point of the Arabs and the birthplace of Islam, the Arabian Peninsula—today comprising the countries Saudi Arabia, Yemen, Oman, the United Arab Emirates, Qatar, Bahrain, and Kuwait—is the origin of music that is much less known than that of more populous countries of Arabic speech. This workshop represents a rare opportunity to bring together senior and younger scholars in order to pose fundamental questions about what is already known, and what kinds of information would be needed to identify key issues in the musical life of today and of the recent past.   Image: Hatim Oweida/AramcoWorld                                                                     Convened by                              Virginia Danielson Director of the Library ,          NYUAD                                        Walter Feldman Professor of Music ,          NYUAD                                          Hosted by                              NYU Abu Dhabi Institute                                                                                              Kuwaiti Heritage: The Mayouf Bahri Band               Established in 1962, The Mayouf Bahri Band is renowned in Kuwait as a leading performer conserving the traditions of Kuwaiti Pearl Diving Music, as well as other folk music genres. This program features pearl diving songs, introduced and explained by an expert musicologist. NYUAD Arts Center                                                            The NYUAD Art Gallery                                                                                                                            Breadcrumbs                                  Home                                               Academics                                               Academic Divisions                                               Multidisciplinary                                               Arab Crossroads                                                          Arab Crossroads                                                     Program                              Faculty                              Courses                              Capstone                              Talks & Events                              Arabic Study Abroad Opportunities                                                                              Arab Crossroads Studies takes advantage of Abu Dhabi’s geographical location in the Arabian Peninsula, at the crossroads of the three continents of the Eastern hemisphere: Africa, Asia, and Europe. The historical, sociopolitical, and cultural interactions among these regions have opened engaging domains of study in both the humanities and social sciences. The flow of people, ideas, and commodities through the Gulf has made it a cosmopolitan and culturally hybrid setting for many centuries. The historical archives testify to this richness, which can also be gleaned from the artistic, architectural and musical developments, the variety of spoken languages, and the diversity of people who now live in the Gulf region.     Abu Dhabi is located in one of the most important regions in the world. The Arabian Peninsula is home to Islam’s holiest sites, and contains at least sixty percent of the world’s proven fossil fuel reserves. Having experienced foreign domination and experiencing political upheaval, Arab nations are evolving extremely rapidly. Abu Dhabi is a natural setting for studying the complex cultural, political, and economic dynamics of the Arab and Islamic worlds. The Arab Crossroads Studies program provides a portal for the global NYU community to study and engage with the cultural and intellectual diversity of this complex region, one we might think of as a space of multiple encounters and transactions.                                 Multidisciplinary Curriculum     History and Religion , which includes a broad and solid grounding in the pre-modern and modern social, cultural, religious and economic landscapes of the region. These courses focus on primary source documents to introduce students to the rich and varied history of the region as well as to the doctrinal and social aspects of the religious traditions that have shaped it.     Society and Politics , which includes a detailed and nuanced examination of the contemporary landscape of the region. These courses draw on anthropology, ethnography, political science, and sociology to elucidate the complex cultural, social, and political developments taking place today.     Arts and Literature , which includes a careful study of the literary, artistic, and philosophical landscapes of the region. These courses explore the literatures, arts, and physical environments of the region within their broader historical and social contexts.                                                                  Major in Arab Crossroads Studies                                                    The major in Arab Crossroads Studies combines multidisciplinary study with rigorous training in Arabic language.                                                              Concentration in Arab Crossroad Studies                                                    Complete a concentration in Arab Crossroads Studies with four courses.                                                              Regional Study Trips                                           Explore traditional irrigation in Oman.                                                                                                                             Village near Jabal Ali, Sultanate of Oman                                     Faculty Members                   Faculty Member Research Areas   Pascal Ménoret Modern Middle East; Saudi Arabia; Urbanism; Social Anthropology; Resistance and Protest Movements.  Philip Kennedy Medieval Arabic language and literature; classical poetry and poetics; adab; narrative and fiction; recognition/anagnorisis in literature; Qur'an and Tafsir.  Nathalie Peutz Anthropology; Ethnography; Borderland Studies; Yemen.  Justin Stearns Islamic History; Al-Andalus; Medieval and Early Modern Thought; History of Science; Religous Studies.                                                            Library of Arabic Literature (LAL)                                                    The Library of Arabic Literature project includes an international editorial board of leading Arabic scholars from around the world, each of whom will discuss their work at public workshops and lectures at NYU Abu Dhabi and other Abu Dhabi schools.                                                                       Pascal Menoret                       Assistant Professor of Middle Eastern Studies   He has published The Saudi Enigma: A History (2005) and is currently writing a book on the politics of youth in the Saudi capital, Riyadh.                                     Abu Dhabi Events                                               Boom Cities: Urban Development in the Arabian Peninsula                                                          Boom Cities: Urban Development in the Arabian Peninsula                                                              Conference      Boom Cities: Urban Development in the Arabian Peninsula                  Open to the Public                                    Date                   December 3-4, 2012                                                             Time           9:00am - 5:00pm                                                     Location           NYUAD Downtown Campus, Abu Dhabi                     View map                                          Related Links                              Agenda                                                                     Cities in the Arabian Peninsula are at the intersection of global energy markets, local and regional politics, international investment, religious networks, and labor migrations. This conference convenes international specialists of urban studies to map the latest evolutions in the field.   Papers prepared for and presented at this conference were published in the Fall 2013 volume of Arabian Humanities , an international journal of Archaeology and Social Sciences in the Arabian Peninsula published by The French Centre in Sana’a for Archaeology and Social Sciences (CEFAS).                                                                        Convened by                              Claire Beaugrand Postdoctoral Research Fellow ,          Institut Français du Proche-Orient, Beirut                                        Amélie Le Renard Research Fellow ,          Centre National de la Recherche Scientifique, France                                        Pascal Menoret Assistant Professor of Arab Crossroads Studies ,          NYUAD                                        Roman Stadnicki Head of Urban Studies Department ,          Centre d'Études et de Documentation Économiques, Juridiques et Sociales, Cairo
